articleContent.title: Arpeggio: Major 7th in A# (Shape: D)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: Major 7th in A# (Shape: D)

## Brief Description
An arpeggio is a musical technique where the notes of a chord are played individually in a sequence. This arpeggio is a Major 7th in the key of A#, played in the shape of a D chord.

## Breakdown of Notes and Intervals
- Root (A#)
- Major 3rd (C)
- Perfect 5th (D#)
- Major 7th (G)

## Musical Flavor and Genre
This Major 7th arpeggio brings a jazzy and sophisticated flavor to music. It is commonly used in jazz, soul, and R&B genres to add a smooth and rich sound to chord progressions.

## 3 Songs
1. **"Autumn Leaves" by Joseph Kosma**: This jazz standard features Major 7th arpeggios in various sections, showcasing the elegance of this arpeggio in a melodic context.
  
2. **"Isn't She Lovely" by Stevie Wonder**: The intro and interlude of this Motown classic include Major 7th arpeggios, contributing to the soulful and harmonic feel of the song.
  
3. **"Don't Know Why" by Norah Jones**: In this contemporary jazz-pop ballad, Major 7th arpeggios are used to create a dreamy and introspective atmosphere, adding depth to the song's structure and emotion.
